Question: The fact that many luxury brands have flocked into China shows that   _  .

th 'The answer is: <A/B/C/D>'.

Solution: 

The fact that many luxury brands have flocked into China shows that China has given up its own culture.

Explanation: 

China has been a manufacturing hub for decades and has always been known for its manufacturing prowess. With the growth of its economy, the manufacturing sector has expanded to cater to the needs of its consumers. This has led to the rise of many luxury brands in China. The growth of the luxury market in China has been attributed to the rise of the middle class in China. The middle class has been able to afford the luxury products, which have been available in China for a long time. Additionally, China has also benefited from the growth of its economy, which has led to an increase in the purchasing power of its consumers. This has led to the growth of the luxury market in China.

The fact that many luxury brands have flocked into China shows that China has given up its own culture.

Option A) China has given up its own culture

Explanation: 

In recent years, China has been facing a decline in its own culture. The rise of global brands, such as Nike and Adidas, has led to the decline of Chinese brands. This has been attributed to the rise of global brands, which have been able to cater to the needs of consumers"}]
